Replies.Reply: sized, leather WRESTLING DUMMY from the mat to stand in front of him. He performs a series of repetitive moves - hooking one arm under the dummy's arm, then the other; one side, then other. Again and again. It looks almost as if he's dancing gently with it.
Why do I do it? Why do I push myself to my limits - of pain, of exhaustion - every day of my life?
In 13 months - if I train right, if I push myself - I'll be going to Seoul - that's a city in South Korea. Does anyone know why?
Does anyone know what this is?
Well we're going to give it absolutely everything we've got.
And this is for the trophy case.
No. Can I get extra meat on that?
I always get extra meat. Every time I come here.
Coach Teller? This is Mark Schultz--

The minute you step on the mat, you are exactly who you are. You can't hide. You can't pretend you trained harder than you did, you want it more than you do. My brother Dave and me care about this more than we care about anything. The difference between the number one guy in the world and the number four guy is paper thin. The one who wins is the one who wants it more, who's willing to sacrifice, who can take the pain. I can take the pain. My brother Dave can take the pain. Can you take the pain?
I talk about all this in my instructional videotape - which you can purchase at the end of the day for a nominal fee.
You been calling me and hanging up?
You win a gold medal for them. And still. Nothing. No respect.
They said it was the library.
Thank you, sir. I'm proud of that day.
To be perfectly honest, we don't often talk.
Oh. Well. I take the mornings on my own - as you said, strength training, endurance - then I meet up with my brother - you know Dave Schultz - ?
- I meet up with him at the U-W gym, we work out whatever free time we can grab between team practice.
I want to be the best in the world.
I started kind of late - high school sophomore.
I was... well, truthfully, I was...
there was my brother, he was running towards me - screaming -
It's always been his sport. He let me inside. I'm just lucky to be very very good at it.
25 thousand a year. He said name your price and I said the highest price that came into my head. We'd get to hand-pick our own team, wrestlers we want to work with -
No - I mean... when I say we, I mean - you and me... could choose a team. Together.

As soon as you meet him you'll understand. He sees what we're after. He cares about America - old family, basically paid for the Revolutionary War - he gets it. He wants to help us win, help restore our pride.

Dave - this is it. This is what we've wanted our whole lives - just to train - you and me - not to have to deal with USA Wrestling, or Harper and his corrupt university program - not to have to think about anybody else...
I'm speaking to my brother, that okay with you?
The deer hunting on his farm's supposed to be amazing...
The Worlds are sixty days away.
Du Pont's taking his money out of the Villanova program. They'll pull the plug on that. So. Dan Bane could come. I - I guess Dan Bane.
I don't know how to do this without you.
A spot's always open for you if you decide to come.
I'm here to see John du Pont?
Yeah. Well - not today exactly, but, yes. This week. Sometime.
In the meantime can I use the -
That could be a good policy.
I've actually got suggestions for about half the roster.
Yes sir, I drove straight down.
I didn't realize he was married.
Has he always lived with his mother?
Thank you. Do you want to come in?
- The fridge is full - you probably know better than me what's in there-
Sir, you need me for something?
Pair up. On the mat. Up and down.
Gecko? Great wrestler. What do you want to know?
Right. Look. Dave's... he's got a good situation going up in Madison.
Mr. du Pont, I don't... you can't buy Dave.
I wasn't... I didn't realize you wanted him to coach.
I'm pretty sure that's John's mother.
I told him how excited you were to meet him.
I want to show you this downblock -
Too difficult to come say hello to Mr. du Pont?
It's John du Pont. One of the most generous men in America. He's gonna save USA Wrestling.
Can you not do that in here?
I'm trying to get advice from my brother, get ready for the finals -
I'm not the one frigging smoking.
I don't want to let you down.
You don't have to do this.
It's not gonna happen. He got offered a contract extension at Wisconsin, Team USA wants him to train Olympic wrestlers next summer, he - it's not gonna happen.
Uh - well - not all that much -
John Eagle du Pont, highly respected ornithologist, author, world explorer, phil... phila...
... highly respected ornithologist, author, world explorer, phil...
Mr. Du Pont will be making his return to competitive sports in the over-50 category at the Masters' League du Pont Wrestling Invitational in Phoenix, Arizona this March.
I'm so proud to introduce my mentor. He has the ability to look at me and see where I am in life.
and I found one in the Golden, uh... the Gold Eagle of America -
We just need some more talc.
You've done the training, you learned the moves. You're ready to rumble, boss.
When Dave's son, Alex, was born he had some problems with his lungs.
When he gives you the slightest opening, you gotta shoot in on him.
Hi, Boss. How you doing? Any soreness from the match?
Yeah, no, exactly - we've got an intense workout scheduled this afternoon. Real intense one. So we're taking the morning to rest up.
John, seriously, I don't know how else to say it. It's not gonna happen. You can't buy Dave. It's just not gonna happen.
Stan, please. I need to see him.
Yeah, of course. Just... just give me a minute.
- Please. I'm asking you to not...
Need to study up. Fix some weakness.
I don't know what you're talking about.
It's over. I'm done. You lost. I lost. It's over.
Were you in the Big House yesterday?
In the afternoon? Because I got turned away when I came within fifty yards of the house.
I talked to Bachman at SMU last night. He says they're expanding the program. There'll be room for both of us in the fall -
- I told him we could all get on the phone next weekend -
- SMU's gonna make a move, they're gonna take a run at it - we can be there at the beginning -
- I can't do this anymore. I can't do it -
- If we at least let Bachman know by the end of the week we'll have a place to go to after -
You're not thinking of staying here...?
What does that mean? When are you gonna you see your own forehead?
I don't know. I just know I'm supposed to charge extra for extra meat.
It's extra for extra meat. They told me. 65 cents.
More than ten? Dragging weight the whole way?
You're a sick fuck, you know that?
Place is looking good, by the way.
I hope you don't have anything booked for Saturday.
I need a favor. This school called me months ago to do a gig but now I can't. Nancy's got a thing all day so I gotta watch the kids. You free?
Coach Vinson, Radnor High. I'll let him know you'll call tomorrow.
And Mark. Please come back to the gym. You don't have to do anything with the team. Just train with me.
I need you there. Stay focused on what's important. For both of us.
You remember Fred Cole from USA Wrestling.
Come by the house, have dinner with me and Nance and the kids.
What does du Pont get out of it?
I got a good thing going here. I got a contract. Nancy's happy, Alex likes his school...
Tell me your plan. Who you gonna train with?
I think you could make something of it.
This is Alex, that's my wife, Nancy, our daughter Danielle.
Come on in. Can I get you a drink -
Well, I know what I need.
The window's open. Relax. Show me what you want me to look at.
I hadn't seen you yet. I just want to make sure everything's okay.
You know, Nancy and the kids are here.
Good. You should stop in, say hi.

There's this big match between an American and a Russian. The Russian is a monster, never lost, kills everybody with this hold called The Pretzel. So the American coach tells his wrestler, "Listen, whatever you do don't let this guy get you in The Pretzel or you're dead." Sure enough, match starts, the Russian gets him in The Pretzel.

The coach buries his head in his hands because he know's it's all over. Suddenly, he hears the crowd roar. When he looks up the Russian is flying through the air - he lands on his back, the American jumps him. Pins him. Boom. The match is over.

"Nobody's ever gotten out of The Pretzel," the coach says afterward, "How'd you do it?" "Well, Coach, I was just about to give up when I opened my eyes and there was this big hairy pair of balls right in front of my face. I had nothing to lose, so with my last ounce of strength I craned my neck and bit those babies as hard as I could."
The coach says, "And that did the trick?"
"Coach, you'd be surprised how motivated you get when you bite your own balls."
He gives you opportunity, jump on it. Hard. Drive him down.
Okay. Okay. You heard the Head Coach. No mercy.
Would you give us a little room?

- when he grabs for your elbow, goes for head position - your hand on his wrist needs to come up immediately, suck his arm to your chest, right hook over the top for the headlock, take him down, drive him down -
Why'd you take off so suddenly?
You been doing this since you left?
What's going on with you and John?
You seemed kind of upset in the gym.
Okay. You want me to leave you alone, I'll leave you alone. You decide you want to talk, you know where to find me.
You know what, Coach? It's Sunday.
Get after him, Mark! Shoot low!...
He's open to the left. He leaves his entire left side open. You gotta get after that fucker! Make him pay. Now or never...
Double elimination, buddy. You'll get it back.
Open up - I know you're in there.
Mark. I'm gonna kick it in if you don't open it.
What's going on with you? You got a match in four hours.
Jesus Christ, tell me you didn't eat all this.
You got to weigh in before every match.
Do you know what I'd give to have the extra years you've got? To have one more shot? To not have to start coaching full time? Do you?!
I'm done, Mark. I've lost a step.
I'm with you, Mark. You're not in this alone.
How long does he have to make weight?
C'mon, fat boy, you got 90 minutes to cut 12 pounds.
I'm having some trouble finding John. He's not in his room -

- I wanted to check in with him. I had a kind of uncomfortable thing with John before the match this afternoon - Mark was in a really delicate place, and I had to ask John to not be in his corner. I just wanted to make sure he's okay with everything. And that he's happy with the result. With how things turned out.
We live here. We're part of Team Foxcatcher.
Dave and Nancy Schultz. Mark Schultz.
- this guy just made the Olympic team.
John wrote me a check for ten thousand dollars.
Get your head on straight and do this.
I'm a coach here. I get paid by John. I was meeting with John.
- You need to focus on what's happening a month from now. Not -
- Don't do this. Don't do it. Stay clear about what we're working for.
I will make sure you're taken care of after Seoul. I'll talk to John -
I don't know, Mark. The schools are great, the kids are happy. They have eight hundred acres to run around in...
If you win next month you're in a class by yourself, you write your own ticket. You live your own life however you want. Focus on that.
I'll be here. Whenever you need me.
To remind me to pick up the kids from school.
I don't have to. You just told me.
My name's Dave Schultz. I'm Coach and head of recruiting here at Foxcatcher, under Head Coach John "Eagle" du Pont -
- Coach du Pont, uh, understands excellence, he represents...
- His... commitment to this sport is complete. He's made himself um, an... an expert in the sport of wrestling...
I'll commit to remaining at Foxcatcher so long as John wants me here, but only if my brother is taken care of.
So long as I'm here, Mark will continue to be paid.
Whether or not he chooses to stay.
You're welcome to test the theory.
We can see how many wrestlers stay if I decide to go.
I hope it doesn't come to that.
I'd also ask John to understand the delicate nature of the lead-up to Seoul, and please allow Mark some space. Let him train just with me.
I was waiting for the right moment to bring it up with you. You haven't exactly been in a receptive frame of mind.
This is your moment to prove yourself - your moment to step out alone, away from everyone, into the spotlight. This has nothing to do with me, nothing to do with John -
- nothing to do with anyone but you. This is you, Mark. This is you. Focus and take what's yours!
He's made himself an - an expert in the art and sport of wrestling...
We... consider John... one of us.
Hey there, Mark, how you been?
All right, Dave. Let us know if we can count on you. We'll talk soon.
We're so very sorry about your mother's passing.
May I ask what sort of a donation we're discussing?
We'll all, of course, just need to get him to sign off on this.
Mr. Schultz, I'm Brandon. Welcome to Philadelphia.
Feel free to look around the library. Mr. du Pont will be up shortly.
They're Mrs. du Pont's. We all just keep our distance.
Mr. du Pont? He's not. Mrs. du Pont's his mother.
Utilities are paid for - gas, electric. Refrigerator's stocked for now, but in the future you're responsible for feeding yourself.
Someone will bring your car around.
Mr. du Pont? I think so.

- I know who you are - I've watched your Olympic victory enough times to know exactly who you are, every inch of you. Please, put your bag down, make yourself comfortable, sit, make yourself at home -

I watched the video of your Olympic run again last night. After you broke the arm of the Turk - after they disqualified you, handed you a loss - after they put an extra official on you to watch your holds - all of which were legal - after all that you rack up seven straight wins to take the medal. For your country. Thrilling. Thrilling.
You should be. I'm proud of that day. I'm proud of you on that day.
I want to tell you how much I appreciate your coming here. I know it cuts into your training. I imagine that's every day for you?
Of course, of course, yes, I know him. I mean, not personally, but yes, of course, I do know him.
And they provide you with everything you need?
I'd like to see you win this upcoming tournament -
- I'd like to help you win this upcoming tournament. It's a big one, yes?
Why do you do it, Mark?
I want you to be the best in the world. I want this country to be the best in the world.
I'm concerned. I'm concerned by what I see in these Unites States.
When did you win your first match?
You won that match. Not him.
The U.S. Olympic Committee refuses to recognize that training for international competition is a full time job. Why is that? Why is that?
I want you all to have a home.
I wish every American could come here and see for themselves. See the price of freedom. It's not free at all.
The sacrifices of the troops that first long winter remind me of what you athletes go through.
I'm gratified my family could play a small part in the history here.
We can't choose the family we're born to. But we can make our own.
I can't think of anyone I'd rather build a team with.
They're setting him up in the chalet?
When you spot one, you'll see with each hoot there's a white flash in his collar. His throat swells, and he reveals to you the lighter feathers he keeps hidden underneath.
It's from ten years ago, but I thought you might find it interesting.
- No. You need your rest. You need to get started bright and early.
- I had a wonderful night a few years back when I spotted all eight Northeast species. Right here on the farm.
What do we have - two months to the Worlds?
Good. Good to hear. Hamstring coming back.
I can't get you anything at all?
Talk to me about Roberto Garcia.
Just a sense. Keep your eye on him.
You see the artistry, the care, the craftsmanship that went into making this great American symbol? You see the face hidden among the feathers?
We need to exert the same care in crafting a world-class wrestling experience here at Foxcatcher.
How're we doing with Dave Schultz?
You were going to speak to him again. When's he coming?
He is a world class competitor - a world class coach. We are building a world class team. He belongs here. Tell me what I have to offer him.
Wrestle and coach. We all coach each other. Support each other.
What do you think? Right to left, or left to right?
John du Pont. It's a pleasure to meet you in person finally.
Thank you. No. I need to be getting back. But, don't worry - we'll make a Foxcatcher out of you yet.
Mark. Dave just won. It's your turn.
I can't.... I've watched you these past months...
I can't imagine being let down by you.
Mother's idea of sport is riding a horse that's chasing a dog that's chasing a fox. I don't share her affection for horseflesh -
They hang their wrestling medals, place in trophies and other awards - leaving the TOP FEW HOOKS EMPTY.
You've brought honor to Team Foxcatcher.
321 days to Seoul, gentlemen. 321 days. Let's get to work.
Please. Call me John. Or Coach.
You spoke to him again at the Worlds.
Do you believe in this team?
- Do you believe we deserve this country's best talent?
- I pay for results not only on the mat, but in recruiting the best of the best to Foxcatcher Farms.
It's probably best. Dave intimidates you. You don't believe you can ever do better than your brother. Glass ceiling. Impossible for you to break through.
- Well. You're the public face of Foxcatcher.
- What do you know about Masters League wrestling tournaments?
- Because I'm thinking of entering one.
It's wonderful. It's exactly what I needed from you.
I think you were below me by a couple of steps when you hugged me at the Worlds.
Brandon and I prepared some remarks.
Don't be nervous. You'll do great.
It helps put everything in perspective. Trust me....
That's the one! That's the one I need!
What I need is the gun turret.

The gold medal Mark won in 1984 was tarnished. Tarnished by Jimmy Carter. Tarnished by the unpatriotic acts of that democrat administration. He caused the entire Eastern bloc to boycott our Los Angeles Games. Mark will have an opportunity to shine up that medal at the World Championships in just a few short weeks. To prove his worth in front of the assembled nations of the globe...
When I was fourteen - my father had left us long before that - my best friend was Clifford Holt, our gardener's son. Then I found out Mother had been paying Cliff to be friends with me.
It's good to know you and I have come to this... friendship without any of that nonsense. Financial nonsense.
I've rearranged some of the horse ribbons, Mother...
... Some of the older prizes in the trophy case.
To make room for Team Foxcatcher medals.... For the wrestling awards.
Including this, Mother. Ha. Which I've actually just won.
Just some of the older ones. From the case. From the Rosemont case.
I went by the gym - it's almost noon - and there's no one in there.
Who precisely is in charge around here?
Where do we stand on Dave?
David Schultz. Your brother. When is he coming to Foxcatcher?
We need someone to take charge around here, someone to lead.
New moves. Wrestling moves. Need to try them out.
You've got more in you than that.
You've got to dig deep. Find out what's inside. Discover what you're made of.
He was talking to you about something and you seemed pretty upset.
What was he saying to you?
I'd like to show you something. Why don't you hop in?
- Need to show you something. At the battlefield. Come. Sit. Come.
And.... break! Gentlemen, well done! Listen up. Team. Listen up.

A number of you will be travelling with me to the Olympic Trials in Pensacola next week. From the moment you leave these hallowed training grounds, you will be in competition. There's no lying in a fight. Who you think you are in the moments leading up to a fight, and who you are when the fight begins -
Raul Garcia, come up here for a moment.
The period begins before the whistle blows, when the other wrestler feels you above him, feels your purpose.
Need to get after him, there. Low low low.
Next time, Mark. A good effort.
Here you are. I've been looking all over for you --
No no. All's fine. There's work to be done.
If you and I can't get him there, no one can. We're in this together.
Our challenge... as coaches... as leaders. I have coached... and psychologically prepare... Our Mark Schultz. To capture Olympic Gold...
...I wear many hats. I am leader.
It will not be easy. We have built... our family. Our obligation... is to build...
Yes. Very sad. Very sad days here.
The 40mm grenade launcher that's supposed to be mounted up here.
- It goes right here. Right here.
From the under hook, pivot sideways while pulling down on his arm.
Our challenge... as coaches... as leaders. I have coached... and psychologically prepare... our Mark Schultz... to capture Olympic Gold.
They never leave home, no matter how cold it gets.
You got a problem with me?
Always good to see you, Mark.
Please, eat our food, shit on our lawn. Enjoy yourself...
It's my room, Mark. You don't have to be here.
You can leave. Go to your own room -
Is Mr. du Pont expecting you?
Mr. Beck will see you now.
Okay. Okay. So. Mark Schultz, correct?
All right. Mark. I manage affairs for Mr. du Pont. Look after his interests. If you have a problem, you come to me. If Mr. Du Pont has a problem, I'll come to you. Okay?
Let's talk about what you're doing here. I'd like to make sure we all understand each other. Does that sound like a good policy to you?
Good. I think so, too. First thing I can tell you is that Mr. du Pont is very happy he can help you with your goals. But I want to make sure you're aware of what's expected.
I'm sure you can appreciate that.
I'll take a look at that when you've finished. All right. Now.
How old were you when they separated?
Have you ever been accused of a crime?
Have you ever initiated a lawsuit?
Mr. du Pont's not available right now.
He's got a very full schedule this afternoon. But I'll let him know you stopped by.
- Mark, I hear you. But Mr. du Pont's away for the afternoon on business. He's simply not here.
You're going to have to do this later.
Dave. What can I do for you?
Dave. Mr. du Pont's mother died this morning. He flew home to Philadelphia earlier today.
What we wanted to discuss... Mr. Du Pont spends a significant amount of money for wrestlers' training here at Foxcatcher. Now - in addition -
First: that you will start to offer Foxcatcher Farms - with the Golden Eagle as Head Coach, and Dave Schultz as Coach - as an alternative to Colorado Springs for wrestlers to train.
Second: that the du Pont family name be on all Olympic wrestling singlets and sweatsuits.
We believe that Eagle has earned the right to be named to the official roster of Olympic coaches at Seoul. Which means he would be in Mark Schultz's corner throughout the games.
You can take care of that?
You want him paid even if he leaves? What if he quits?
You're making quite an assumption about the value of your presence here.
First of all, Mark has always been free to train in whatever -
- Just a minute - you've had your say.
- To train in whatever way is most effective for him. Eagle offers his advice and counsel. If Mark chooses to ignore it, that's his loss.
Mr. du Pont would be prepared to accept your financial terms, but only if we get an answer to what we proposed weeks ago.
That John du Pont, Head Coach of Team Foxcatcher, be seated in Mark's corner throughout the Olympic Games.
All right, then. I guess we're done.
I'll catch up with you all later.
Spling Loll - must lay off the pohk flied lice.
- and, of course, the gold medal.
A lot of oil. Please. More oil. It defines the musculature.
Good! Now. Mark. You're winning the gold medal! And you are humbled!
In that case, the Grand Old Party wants to help find you one.
General, any of these models available?
General, John du Pont is hardly your usual civilian.
Which? We might have a couple of those left on the lot.
Uh... I don't know there, son.
Am I supposed to get him a 12-pack of live fucking grenades, too?
I'll have a look later to see exactly what you've done.
Can I see some picture ID's?
Sir! Please turn around and go back the way you came.
Security. Please turn around and go back the way you came.
- We'll let you know when this area is open. Please turn around and go back the way you came.
Here we go, sir. Five tons of fun.
I don't know, sir. I don't... I don't see anything in the order -
Yes, it does. It does mount right there on the top.
From the United States of America, at 82 kilos... Mark Schultz.
... He's coached national and world champions with his unique blend of passion and inspiration...
The symbol of America is the Golden Eagle...
John du Pont is that Golden Eagle.
We've bought several time slots next week on local station WPHI -
- Several late night slots, of course, but there was also an open afternoon half-hour, directly after "The Edge of Night." That should be a good one -
- I'll let you know what the viewership numbers are as soon as I have them.
